column2: ITP - 09.2 Full ITP Kerb and Channel
column8: ITP - 09.2 Full ITP Kerb and Channel

column2: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Site walk over with supervisor and foreperson
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - All services located and marked. Permits issued
Acceptance Criteria - Permits issued and received by qualified staff only
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check the work pack checklist
Acceptance Criteria - Copy of work pack with all documents
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Apply environmental controls to site.
Acceptance Criteria - Consider drainage, noise, dust, weather.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Kerb and channel cut twice, vertically and at a right angle to the kerb.
Acceptance Criteria - Existing sealed surface cut parallel to kerb and at a distance of 500mm
Verifying Document - Refer to DN- ZH-SWMS026
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Remove existing kerb. Pot hole. Excavation no deeper than 300mm
Verifying Document - Refer to RITS D3.3.6
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Subgrade further compacted or excavate the unsuitable material and replace
Verifying Document - Refer to RITS D3.3.6
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Compacted layer of GAP40 75mm deep shall be placed over subgrade.
Acceptance Criteria - Clegg test every 10m shall not be less than 12 CIV after 4 blows.
Verifying Document - Refer to RITS D3.3.6
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Damp the prepared surface and check the weather conditions, Use concrete from certified plant
Acceptance Criteria - Machine not be used to pour curves less than 5m radii.
Verifying Document - Refer to DN- ZH- SWMS026
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Maximum spacing of 3m and minimum 50mm deep
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete paths provide smooth and even surface after finishing.
Verifying Document - Refer to DN- ZH- SWMS026
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Curing period shall not be less than 1 day OR 36 hours?
Verifying Document - Refer to DN- ZH- SWMS026
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - GAP40 compacted 40mm below lip of kerb. Pit sand behind kerb in berm 100mm below top of kerb.
Acceptance Criteria - Clegg test shall not be less than 40 CIV.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - The carriageway to be married into the existing carriageway and new kerb lip.
Acceptance Criteria - concrete must have reached sufficient strength before applying any AC or Chip seal layer
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Berms reinstated with top soil and grass seeded.
Acceptance Criteria - Minimum of 100mm of topsoil and grass seed applied.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Have kerb adaptors been installed? Any visual crack observed? Photos taken? As-built updated?
Frequency - After the completion of job
